Expected Behaviour:
Observed below behavior :
1) Ran 8 fio remote pods on appserv56(initiator) and appserv57(target)
2) Made appserv56 's management interface down
3) All volumes went into "Down" state. After few minutes all volumes went into Available state.
4) And all pods went into Unknown state.
5) I could delete volumes without using -f option

Above behaviour is expected. (Email thread title : Query : Management interface down of initiator node)
Notes / Detailed Description:
1) created 4 volumes on appserv64 making it the target.
2) scheduled 4 fio rc pods on appserv65 making it the initiator
3) shut the management interface of appserv65.
4) After several minutes all the volumes went down and then into available state. Then the volume could be deleted easily without using -f.
5) All the fio rc pods went into pending state.

Test Description: Node management interface down and up after volume moves to Available state
Expected Behaviour: If pod restarts volume should get attach to pod.
Notes / Detailed Description: Took several minutes for pods to change from pending state to running state. But after appserv65 management interface was turned up, all the pods went back into running state and the volumes got attached.

Test Description: Node management interface down and up after volume is deleted
Expected Behaviour: if pod restarts, pod should remain in pending state
Notes / Detailed Description: The rc pod stayed in pending state.

Test Description: With replication Controller node management interface goes down.
Expected Behaviour: Pod should get migrated to another node in the cluster.
Notes / Detailed Description:
1) created 4 volumes on appsserv64 making it the target node.
2) Labeled the other 2 non target nodes as "pod" and used this label to schedule 4 pods. 
3)Thus 4 pods were sceduled on both appserv65 and appserv66, 2 on each making them initiator nodes. 
4) Shut the management interface on appserv66. After several minutes the two volumes attached to appserv66 went down and then into available state.  The pods went into pending state. 
5) However the pods get reschedued on the other initiator node appserv65 and the volumes got attached again.

Expected Behaviour: If initiator reboots before timeout, things should work as they are
Notes / Detailed Description: Initiator took a long time to reboot. All the volumes became available and pods became pending. however, once the node was up, things got back to normal again.
